thread.title: Wilfried Zaha channels Lionel Messi to score the goal of his life in Ivory Coast's 2-0 win over Russia
thread.title_full: Wilfried Zaha channels Lionel Messi to score the goal of his life in Ivory Coast's 2-0 win over Russia

author: Jake Polden
title: Wilfried Zaha channels Lionel Messi to score the goal of his life in Ivory Coast's 2-0 win over Russia
text:
Wilfried Zaha was on target in Ivory Coast's 2-0 win over Russia. 
The Crystal Palace striker doubled his nation's lead in the second half of the international friendly after Jonathan Kodjia broke the deadlock in 30 minutes. 
The 24-year-old picked the ball up on the edge of the area before making a beeline for goal and going around the Russia back-four like cones. 
After skipping past three defenders - as if channelling Lionel Messi - the former Manchester United man made his way into the box. Wilfried Zaha was on target in Ivory Coast's 2-0 win (Photo: AFP) Ivory Coast celebrate during their international friendly (Photo: AFP) 
Russia shot-stopper Igor Akinfeev came out to close the forward down, but he quickly responded by smashing the ball into the roof of the net. 
Kodjia similarly scored a great goal in the first half when he found the top corner of the net after cutting in from the left. Jonathan Kodjia broke the deadlock in 30 minutes (Photo: AFP) Ibrahim Kamara was in the dugout for Ivory Coast's 2-0 win over Russia (Photo: AFP) 
Marc Wilmots, who was recently appointed Ivory Coast coach, was not in charge for the friendly on Friday. 
Ibrahim Kamara, former Belgium coach, was instead in the dugout for the win. poll loading Did Man United make a mistake letting Zaha go? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
